info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 6 at 7:08PM EDT until August 7 at 9:00AM EDT by NWS Wakefield VA
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Wakefield VA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Virginia...
Meherrin River At Lawrenceville affecting Greensville and Brunswick Counties.
For the Chowan Basin...including Franklin at US Highway 58/258, Rawlings, Stony Creek, Sebrell, Lawrenceville, Emporia, Franklin... Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Meherrin River at Lawrenceville.
* WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning.
* IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Pasture land north of the river, downstream of the gage, begins to flood.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 PM EDT Wednesday the stage was 13.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 15.3 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.3 feet on 01/16/2005. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 715 AM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING
